alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sapello, or 11 miles southeast of Mora, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sapello, Golondrinas and Manuelitas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 352 and 353. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 7, and near Mile Marker 11. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 6 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands
